rev.comment: /* Popular culture */ removing Spider Man reference, as it's quite unlikely that it was a reference to the ship
rev.diff:
Line 56: Line 56:
*The first scenes of the film ''[[Manhattan Melodrama]]'' recreate the disaster.
*The first scenes of the film ''[[Manhattan Melodrama]]'' recreate the disaster.
*The 2005 [[Hugo award]] nominated novella "[[Time Ablaze]]" by [[Michael A. Burstein]] ([[Astounding magazine|''Analog'']], June 2004) concerns a time traveller who comes to record the disaster. The story was published to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the disaster.
*The 2005 [[Hugo award]] nominated novella "[[Time Ablaze]]" by [[Michael A. Burstein]] ([[Astounding magazine|''Analog'']], June 2004) concerns a time traveller who comes to record the disaster. The story was published to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the disaster.

*The 2002 film [[Spider-Man_(film)|Spider Man]] features a character named General Slocum.
 
*The General Slocum disaster was featured in the documentary ''My Father's Gun''.
